name: Aston Maui Hill

reviews.title: ResortQuest Maui Hill in Kihei is superb!
reviews.text: My family of 5 just got back from 15 wonderful nights in our favorite place - Maui!

We stayed for 8 nights at the ResortQuest Maui Hill and loved it. The condo was very spacious, huge living room, dining room with table for 6, 2 big bedrooms, 2 bathrooms, washer and dryer and kitchen with every utensil, dish and appliance you could need. One whole wall is glass doors that open onto the lanai. The pool area and grounds were great, and each condo has a parking space right outside of their back door. The housekeeping came every day with fresh towels, made the beds and vaccumed.
reviews.title: Great room, great value

likes.liked: — The value, service, and proximity to the beach

reviews.title: Greatest Vacation
reviews.text: We were very happy and would definitely recommend the Maui Hill in South Maui!!

reviews.title: Loved ResortQuest Maui Hill
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at Maui Hill during our honeymoon. The room and the service were both fantastic and I would definitely stay there again. We were expecting the typical small, one-bedroom unit, and were quite pleasantly surprised to find out we had two bathrooms, a full kitchen, and a very large living room with a pull-out bed. The front desk staff was very friendly and helpful, and they were still working late at night (thank goodness, because we got lost in the dark on the way there, thanks to poor directions from MapQuest). I highly recommend them.

This has to be the most under-rated and greatest little vacation resort I have ever stayed in. It is quiet and has all the amenities that a person could want. The grounds are beautiful and well kept with large clean and very comfortable condo units. A large pool was very clean and uncrowded. All the personnel were very helpful and willing to go the extra mile to do whatever we needed. We greatly enjoyed our stay here and will definitely stay here when we return.
reviews.title: wonderful holiday- Maui Hill was most excellent

reviews.text: There were 7 of us staying 3 nights in a one bedroom & 2 bedroom units. They were accross from each other, so we were glad about that. When we walked into our unit, our mouths dropped open.....it was beautiful! Then we learmed that the upstaires was locked off to us, so we had ony the 2 bedroom....& very large lanai, so we were Ok with that. Us 6 women could do with that. We did have everything we needed....except the ocenview we booked. I don't think we could have even seen the ocean with binoculars!
reviews.title: Not what I expected!

likes.disliked: — Soo far away from the ocean & beaches.

reviews.text: Then the unit became scary when our un-wanted guest invited himself in....a very large cockroach!!! He tried to invite himeself to dinner that night....& I think he even came with his own luggage!!
reviews.title: Great place to stay

reviews.text: We liked the pool area, we used the outdoor grills for dinner, we used the free breakfast & MaiTai Thursday. (Tho I have tasted better MaiTai's). Both were to get you to book activities thru them.
reviews.title: Great place!

likes.disliked: — A bit of a walk to the beach

reviews.text: I thought Maui in general was a whole lot busier than 2yrs. ago when we spent a whole week there. It really could have been due tto Spring Break tho. I dreaded going out on the roads after noon everyday!
reviews.title: Great Condo Hotel

reviews.text: Wow! Our condo was GREAT. The kitchen was fully furnished with updated appliances. Full of dishware, glassware, cookware and utensils. The furnishings had a tropical theme. The living room had a new LCD TV and beautiful lanai. Each bedroom had a king-sized bed with a television set and each had it's own lanai. Two bathrooms for a family of five was perfect. And a washer and dryer! We had maid service so our condo was nice and fresh at the end of the day. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Property wasn't on the beach but was within walking distance. We had excursions planned each day so it wasn't an issue. Quiet facility. Nice pool and whirlpool. Free towels for the beach days were a huge bonus. I would highly recommend ResortQuest Maui Hill.
reviews.title: Awesome for large families - loved loved loved it!

likes.disliked: — sink was plugged & oven didn't work properly

reviews.text: Spent a week in a 2 bedroom unit at the Maui Hill. It was wonderful.
reviews.title: loved the maui hill!

likes.liked: — Very spacious, all the amenities of home

reviews.text: We received a free upgrade when we checked in and we ended up with a unit that could sleep 10!! We had 2 big bedrooms, plus a loft with another pull out sofa along with another pull out sofa in the living room.
reviews.title: Like Being Home!

reviews.text: The unit itself was updated and very spacious, with everything you need. The washer and dryer came in very handy!
reviews.title: I didn’t want to leave the room!

likes.liked: — Size and cleanliness of my unit.
likes.disliked: — Attitude of check-out staff in morning. Not mean but not pleasant.

reviews.text: The staff were very polite and pleasant to deal with,and when we had a minor issue they promptly dealt with it.
reviews.title: Great place, would definately return

likes.liked: — Clean! Spacious with kitchen and room service.

reviews.text: The grounds were kept neat and tidy and the pool was excellent! We stayed over Christmas and on Christmas Eve, they had a free bbq for all and had Santa fly in by helicopter to greet the kids and give them small gifts. It was very nice and my kids were thrilled to see Santa in Hawaii.
reviews.title: Rude incompetent Check in, musty smelling rooms, Ok but not Great

reviews.text: My family and I stayed Aug. 1st to Aug.8th. We had a wonderful time. We are a family of five with three teenagers. The condo was very large, and suited us very well. It had two bedrooms, two baths and nice size living room and a huge lanai. The kitchen was very well equiped. The decor was slightly outdated, but everything was very clean and it was decorated in a nice hawaiian style. The grounds were very nice and it was extremely quiet and peaceful there. We booked an ocean view room. We could see the ocean, but it was a partial view at best. It was still a beautiful view. I would highly recommend staying at this property!
reviews.title: Wonderful place to stay!

likes.disliked: — Wish it was a little closer to the ocean

reviews.text: We stayed in a 2 bedroom 2 bath. For a family of 5 we had plenty of space. The room was clean and well equipped. The kitchen has everything you need to eat and cook. There were 3 boogie boards, 3 beach chairs, a beach umbrella and a cooler in the room. Also, there were DVD's, books and hard wire internet available free of charge. The pool and jacuzzi area is very nice. The patios are really big and we had an excellent view of the ocean. You can walk to the beach if you walk to the bottom of the complex and take the stairs down to the sidewalk, walk one block and then cross the street to Kamaole Beach III. We drove, it takes about 2 minutes. Maid service came daily. The office staff is helpful. If we go back to Maui we will stay at Maui Hill again!
reviews.title: We would stay there again

reviews.text: Our stay at Maui Hill ended up being somewhat disapointing, not only because of the overall state of the property and units, but because of the deceiving description and bad staff attitude. The problems started at check-in when it turned out that many ocean view units here don't have a decent ocean view. In fact many garden view units have the same view of the ocean as some of the ocean view units. At other properties these would be considered partial ocean views at best. We finally had to come to an agreement to pay the garden view instead of the ocean view rate.
reviews.title: Deceiving description, Adequate units, Bad customer service.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What really bothered us, and the reason why we will not stay here again, was the attitude of most of the front desk staff, which we found very unpleasant because of their argumentative behaviour and sarcasm. We were told we shouldn't be complaining because we got a good rate (we booked direct though Maui Hill itself by the way). This was a surprise because the other ResortQuest-managed properties we stayed at (3 others during this stay) were all very helpful. Unfortunately, they just take customers for granted here. We were given wrong information several times (they would rather lie than say they don't know) and it just seems there's no communication between the different staff members.
reviews.title: Best kept secret in Maui

likes.liked: — Beautiful condo with all great ammenities

reviews.text: The units (we saw 4 of them) were all looking rather dull, outdated and dark and had old appliances. On the positive side they were quite spacious and clean and HSIA was complimentary. Units have an air conditionner in each room but the one in the main bedroom is located just over the bed and was very noisy. We found it troublesome to sleep with it turned on. Finally the location isn't really desirable as the beaches are not at walking distance. Driving into town was very slow due to the horrendous traffic.
reviews.title: Nice Condos

likes.liked: — size of condos, free parking, free internet access

description: Great ocean views with warm aloha service. This private oasis, just minutes from the premier resort area of Wailea, offers extra-spacious condos with private lanais, and the amenities and activities of a hotel in a tropical setting. Golf, shops and dining nearby. A perfect alternative to more expensive Wailea super-resorts.
